page.title: 11POND HALL FARM
page.content: We visited{Pond Hall Farm}because it is a good example of the type of {farming}that goes on in this area. Most of the farms are small, and are mainly concerned with{arable}farming. Mrs. Bellingham rents the farm and she told us that most of the land was used for growing a variety of{cereal and grain crops. These are the most important source of money for the farmers in this part of Essex, she told us. However she also told us that some of the farmers keep{chickens}in battery coops, but the only animals which she kept were a few free range hens and some geese. The major land cover of the area, apart from the River Stour, is farmland, and most of that is under cereal crops,for Suffolk, like Essex, is a big cereal growing county.
